clinical_study.brief_title: Exploration of Cluster Headache in a PET-MRI Study
clinical_study.official_title: Exploration of the 5-HT1A Receptor in Cluster Headache : a PET-MRI Study Using the PET Radiopharmaceutical [18F]F13640

brief_summary.textblock: Observational study in PET-MRI using the 5-HT1A agonist PET radiotracer [18F]F13640.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes From t=60 to t=90 after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of 5-HT1A density by measuring non-displaceable binding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 75 minutes from t=150 to t=225 after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of 5-HT1A density by measuring non-displaceable binding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes Ffrom t=60 to t=90 a after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans
75 minutes from t=150 to t=225 after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans
30 minutes from t=60 to t=90 after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of cerebral blood flow (perfusion MRI).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 75 minutes from t=150 to t=225 after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of cerebral blood flow (perfusion MRI).

75 minutes from t=150 to t=225 after [18F]F13640 injection on each scans

secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale. Scores range from 0 to 21. Scores with 7 or less are considered as normal. Scores 8 to 10 as borderline abnormal and 11 to 21 as abnormal (case).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of imaging visit at pain-free remission period up to 24 months after inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale. Scores range from 0 to 21. Scores with 7 or less are considered as normal. Scores 8 to 10 as borderline abnormal and 11 to 21 as abnormal (case).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of imaging visit during cluster period up to 24 months after inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale. Scores range from 0 to 21. Scores with 7 or less are considered as normal. Scores 8 to 10 as borderline abnormal and 11 to 21 as abnormal (case).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During PET-MRI scans, 30 minutes from t=60 to t=90 after [18F]F13640 injection
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of pain during days of PET-MRI using a VAS projected on a screen in the camera (0= no pain; 10= pain as bad as can be)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During PET-MRI scans, 75 minutes from t=150 to t=225 after [18F]F13640 injection
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of pain during days of PET-MRI using a VAS projected on a screen in the camera (0= no pain; 10= pain as bad as can be)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At five points during the day : (1) before scans, (2) time =70minutes, (3) time =105minutes, (4) time=155 minutes, (5) time=240 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of acute anxiety during days of PET-MRI using a VAS questionnaire (0= no anxiety; 10= anxiety as bad as can be)

arm_group.description: Patients will perform two PET-MRI scans: (1) during cluster period and (2) during pain-free remission period. Scans during cluster periods will aim to acquire data before, during and after crisis. Sumatriptan 6mg will be injected subcutaneously under PET-MRI camera to relieve patient pain.

intervention.description: Patients will performed PET-MRI scans. A first 30 minutes acquisition will be performed at time=60min after injection. A second 75 minutes acquisition will be performed at time=150min. Each scans will contain functional dynamic [18F]F13640 PET acquisition, anatomical and functional MRI images acquisition and pain evaluation using a score visual analogic scale.

study_pop.textblock: Male patients with cluster headache episodic and between 20 and 45 years old.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Age between 20 to 45 years old
- Weight between 50 to 90 kg
- No psychiatric or neurologic pathological history
- No cranial trauma history with loss of consciousness
- No juridical protection
- Free and informed consent
- Affiliated with a social security scheme or similar
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject with present or past dependence on alcohol or any other addictive substance according to the DSM-IV-TR criteria, with the exception of nicotine, caffeine and cannabis
- Subject already participating in another biomedical research project or having participated for less than a year in a study using ionizing radiation
- Subject with a contraindication to MRI exams
- Subject with a contraindication to PET scans using [18F] F13640: hypersensitivity to the active substance or to one of the excipients (sodium chloride)
- Subject with a contraindication to sumatriptan
- Patients with an active infectious disease or associated serious and progressive medical pathology
- Subjects with an inability to understand or carry out the study (language barrier, obvious lack of motivation, etc...) as judged by the investigator
- Patient having exceeded the annual amount of compensation authorized for participation in research protocols.

overall_official.affiliation: Centre d'évaluation et traitement de la douleur
